body_part_breakdown.arms_analysis: User demonstrates advanced elbow control in pushups with mastery at angles below 45Â°, but exhibits instability during lower-body movements. Recent squat sessions show compensatory arm movements during balance challenges.
body_part_breakdown.legs_analysis: Significant instability patterns observed in ankles/knees across multiple sessions. Asymmetric acceleration creates joint shear forces. Hip drive imbalance persists during squat descent despite glute activation cues.
body_part_breakdown.core_analysis: Core bracing improves during upper-body work but collapses under lower-body load. Spinal alignment failure occurs specifically when lower extremity instability creates compensatory leaning.

recommended_plan.expected_benefit: Maintains upper-body strength progression while reinforcing established good arm mechanics, preventing skill regression during lower-body focus
External resistance trains knee-out control while dynamically loading glutes, reducing shear forces from asymmetric acceleration
Integrates ankle proprioception training with posterior chain activation - addressing foundational instability while reinforcing hip positioning

best_workout_reason: Achieved near-perfect execution with simultaneous demonstration of depth control, midline stability and tempo mastery - representing technical integration of previously isolated strengths
